alert.note: Alert for Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 11:04AM CDT until June 05 at 3:54PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected along Flat Creek and its tributaries. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry and Stone. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1101 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rainfall occurred over the Flat Creek Basin earlier today. Additional rainfall is expected this afternoon. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway Y, Flat Creek at Highway U, Flat Creek at Highway C and Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Jenkins, Mcdowell, Madry, and Wheelerville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
